channel.title: Hacker News - English
channel.description: Hacker News articles summarized and translated to English

item.title: Ask HN: Who is hiring? (November 2025)
item.description:
Please state the location and include REMOTE for remote work, REMOTE (US) or similar if the country is restricted, and ONSITE when remote work is not an option. Commenters: please don't reply to job posts to complain about something. Readers: please only email if you are personally interested in the job.

Read more

item.title: Learning to read Arthur Whitney's C to become smart (2024)
item.description:
This already shows some funky C. This is used everywhere in the code after this. These are error macros using that mysterious Q defined earlier.

Read more

item.title: Ask HN: Who wants to be hired? (November 2025)
item.description:
Share your information if you are looking for work. Please use this format: Location: Remote: Willing to relocate: Technologies: Résumé/CV: Email: Please only post if you are personally looking for work. Readers: please only email these addresses to discuss work opportunities.

Read more

item.title: Why We Migrated from Python to Node.js
item.description:
Python async sucks I'm a big fan of Django. As for us, we learned a few things: Python doesn't have native async file I/O. Django still doesn't have full async support.

Read more

item.title: State of Terminal Emulators in 2025: The Errant Champions
item.description:
from 2023, in which I documented Unicode support across terminal emulators. The ucs-detect program tests terminal cursor positioning by sending visible text followed by control sequences that request the cursor position. That many terminals perform so slowly was surprising, so I have included the elapsed time in the results.

Read more

item.title: Robert Hooke's "Cyberpunk” Letter to Gottfried Leibniz
item.description:
It comes from a scan of a letter which Robert Hooke wrote to Gottfried Leibniz in 1681. For these reasons, this letter from Hooke to Leibniz has become one of my favourite pieces of niche archival material. And I think that if I had to pick one piece of Hooke's writing that expresses this attitude most clearly, I would have to pick this letter.

Read more

item.title: No Socials November
item.description:
No Socials November November seems to be a ripe month for challenges. Some people grow facial hair. You may decide you want to stay away.

Read more

item.title: Israels top military lawyer arrested after she admitted leaking video of abuse
item.description:
The detention of the military advocate general, Yifat Tomer-Yerushalmi, raises questions about the rule of law in Israel. Rightwing politicians and pundits championed soldiers detained over the case as “heroes”, attacked military investigators as traitors, and called for the case against the soldiers to be dropped. Days later, five soldiers were charged with aggravated abuse and causing serious bodily harm.

Read more

item.title: Python Steering Council unanimously accepts "PEP 810, Explicit lazy imports"
item.description:
>>> lazy import email >>> import sys >>> sys. modules['email'] Traceback (most recent call last): File "", line 1, in KeyError: 'email' >>> email

Read more

item.description:
